parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions several PSD candidates (Larisa Blanari, Mirela Adomnicăi, George Mândruță, and Cristian Șologon) participating in the parliamentary elections in Suceava.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True.  The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and aims to reach a broad audience in Suceava County, as evidenced by the targeting data in the `aaa_info` section. The content is not a private or personal communication.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The clear objective of the post is to encourage voters in Suceava to vote for the mentioned PSD candidates. The candidates answer the question of "why should Suceava voters vote for the PSD team?". This directly aims to influence the electoral outcome.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post presents itself as a Q&A with candidates, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting.  The framing of the questions and the focus on positive aspects of the candidates strongly suggest a promotional, rather than journalistic, intent.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The content is not a personal opinion; it's a coordinated effort to promote specific candidates and their party.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1995817070930630</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by "Informatia ta", features several PSD candidates for the parliamentary elections in Suceava, directly addressing the question of why voters should choose them.  The targeting data shows a focus on Suceava County.  The post's design and content clearly aim to influence voters in favor of the PSD candidates.  While presented as a Q&A, the lack of neutrality and the promotional nature of the responses strongly suggest it's electoral propaganda. The post's end date (1732953600) corresponds to November 23rd, 2024, suggesting the post may violate Article 98 t) if the electoral propaganda period has ended.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Larisa Blanari</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Mirela Adomnicăi</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>George Mândruță</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Cristian Șologon</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PSD</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
[Informatia ta], pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID 1995817070930630) care promovează candidații PSD Larisa Blanari, Mirela Adomnicăi, George Mândruță și Cristian Șologon la alegerile parlamentare din Suceava, răspunzând la întrebarea de ce ar trebui să voteze alegătorii echipa PSD.  Postarea, prin natura sa promoțională și lipsa neutralității, constituie propagandă electorală, având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea candidaților PSD menționați.  Această acțiune este ilegală, deoarece are loc după încheierea perioadei de campanie electorală, conform articolului 98 t).
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
